column1: Znamensk (Russian: Знаменск) is a closed town in Astrakhan Oblast
It was founded in 1948 as Kapustin Yar-1 to serve a missile test range known as Kapustin Yar. Town status was granted in 1962. The closed town was renamed Znamensk in 1992.
The military testing range is officially known as 4GCMP (4th State Central Interspecific Test-site). Kapustin Yar is also the name of a nearby village.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: it is incorporated as the closed administrative-territorial formation of Znamensk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column3: the closed administrative-territorial formation of Znamensk is incorporated as Znamensk Urban Okrug.
